title: Seamus Coleman is 'still pretty down' after horror injury, confirms Republic of Ireland boss Martin O'Neill
text:
Sport Seamus Coleman is 'still pretty down' after horror injury, confirms Republic of Ireland boss Martin O'Neill The Everton full-back has undergone surgery after breaking his tibia and fibula in a challenge with Wales' Neil Taylor Share Seamus Coleman calls for help after Neil Taylor's red card challenge breaks his leg (Photo: Ian Walton)   Thank you for subscribing! Martin O'Neill has revealed Republic of Ireland skipper Seamus Coleman is "still pretty down" as he comes to terms with the horrific leg fracture which has ruined his World Cup qualification dream. 
The 28-year-old Everton full-back remained in hospital in Dublin on Monday two days after undergoing surgery to pin the tibia and fibula in his right leg. 
The bones snapped in a challenge by Wales' Neil Taylor during the previous night's 0-0 draw at the Aviva Stadium. 
And O'Neill was asked about Coleman during his pre-match press conference for Tuesday's friendly against Iceland. Neil Taylor catches Seamus Coleman late (Photo: Sportsfile via Getty Images) 
"I think he's just beginning to come to terms with it. I saw him yesterday and he's still pretty down about it," O'Neill revealed. 
"He's not in as much pain, the operation went very well and it's just a matter of coming to terms with it." poll loading Will Seamus Coleman play again in 2017? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
